title.narrative: Grants Management contributing to domestic accountability in Tanzania

description.narrative: This activity (Grants Management contributing to domestic accountability in Tanzania) is a component of Accountability in Tanzania Programme (ACT) reported by FCDO, with a funding type of 'Procurement of Services' and a budget of £30,831,674. This component benefits Tanzania, and works in the following sector(s): Democratic participation and civil society, Media and free flow of information, Women's equality organisations and institutions. , with the following implementing partners: Crown Agents Limited, KPMG East Africa, London School of Economics and Political Science. The start date is 01-10-2008 and the end date is 30-11-2016.

participating-org.narrative: London School of Economics and Political Science

owner-org.narrative: UK - Foreign, Commonwealth and Development Office (FCDO)

mailing-address.narrative: Public Enquiry Point, Abercrombie House, Eaglesham Road, East Kilbride, Glasgow G75 8EA
